Detailed Description

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
class BinaryAnalysis::InstructionSemantics::BaseSemantics::StateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >

Base class for x86 virtual machine states.

Binary semantic analysis usually progresses one instruction at a time--one starts with an initial state and the act of processing an instruction modifies the state. The StateX86 is the base class class for the semantic states of various instruction semantic policies. It contains storage for all the machine registers and a vector of MemoryCell objects to represent memory.

Member Function Documentation

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
void BinaryAnalysis::InstructionSemantics::BaseSemantics::StateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::clear (  )  [inline]

Initialize state.

The state is initialized using the ValueType default constructor and the memory vector is emptied.

Definition at line 352 of file BaseSemantics.h.

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
void BinaryAnalysis::InstructionSemantics::BaseSemantics::StateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::zero_registers (  )  [inline]

Initialize all registers to zero.

This is done with the ValueType((uint64_t)0) constructor. Memory is not affected.

Definition at line 364 of file BaseSemantics.h.

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
template<typename PrintHelper>
void BinaryAnalysis::InstructionSemantics::BaseSemantics::StateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::print_registers ( std::ostream &  o,
const std::string  prefix = "",
PrintHelper *  ph = NULL 
) const [inline]

Print the register contents.

This emits one line per register and contains the register name and its value. The ph argument is a templatized PrintHelper that is simply passed as the second argument of the underlying print methods for the ValueType.

Definition at line 372 of file BaseSemantics.h.

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
template<typename PrintHelper>
void BinaryAnalysis::InstructionSemantics::BaseSemantics::StateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::print_memory ( std::ostream &  o,
const std::string  prefix = "",
PrintHelper *  ph = NULL 
) const [inline]

Print memory contents.

This simply calls the MemoryCell::print method for each memory cell. The ph argument is a templatized PrintHelper that's just passed as the second argument to the underlying print methods for the ValueType.

Definition at line 380 of file BaseSemantics.h.

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
template<typename PrintHelper>
void BinaryAnalysis::InstructionSemantics::BaseSemantics::StateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::print ( std::ostream &  o,
const std::string  prefix = "",
PrintHelper *  ph = NULL 
) const [inline]

Print the state.

This emits a multi-line string containing the registers and all known memory locations. The ph argument is a templatized PrintHelper pointer that's simply passed as the second argument to the print methods for the ValueType.
